facts.1: Mole Day is celebrated by chemists and chemistry enthusiasts to commemorate Avogadro's number (6.02 x 10^23), a fundamental constant in chemistry.
facts.2: The day is observed from 6:02 AM to 6:02 PM on October 23rd, reflecting the significance of the number 6.02 x 10^23.
facts.3: Mole Day was created to foster interest in chemistry and to promote an understanding of the importance of the mole concept in scientific calculations.

facts.1: National Boston Cream Pie Day celebrates the classic dessert that consists of a sponge cake filled with custard or cream and topped with chocolate glaze.
facts.2: The Boston cream pie was first created in the 19th century at the Parker House Hotel in Boston, Massachusetts.
facts.3: Despite its name, Boston cream pie is actually a cake and was designated the official dessert of Massachusetts in 1996.

facts.1: iPod Day commemorates the launch of the first iPod by Apple Inc. on October 23, 2001, revolutionizing the way people listen to music.
facts.2: The original iPod could store up to 1,000 songs and featured a mechanical scroll wheel for navigation.
facts.3: The iPod's success paved the way for future Apple products, including the iPhone and iPad, and transformed the music industry.
